PERSONA:
meet karen thompson, a 58-year-old african american woman living in the metropolitan area of raleigh-durham, north carolina, in the south atlantic region. born and raised in north carolina, karen has always been deeply rooted in her community. she is married to her high school sweetheart, eric, a retired mechanic who now works part-time at a local hardware store. they have been married for 30 years and have two adult children: a 28-year-old son who works as a software engineer, and a 25-year-old daughter who is a registered nurse. karen is a proud grandmother to her 4-year-old grandson.

education played a significant role in karen's life. she pursued higher education at a local community college, where she earned an associate's degree in business administration. after graduation, karen started her career as an administrative assistant at a financial services company, gradually climbing the corporate ladder to become an operations manager. she has been working for the same company for over 20 years, earning a comfortable salary of $72,500 per year.

karen's family income, combined with eric's part-time earnings, falls into the $70,000 to $80,000 range. they own a cozy, two-story brick house in a suburban neighborhood, where they have lived for over 20 years. their mortgage payments are manageable, and they are proud of having built equity in their home. karen values homeownership and believes it is a key aspect of the american dream.

as a devout protestant, karen regularly attends church services a few times a year, usually on major holidays and special events. she is a born-again christian and identifies as evangelical. her faith plays a vital role in shaping her worldview and values. karen is an independent voter but leans republican, aligning with her conservative ideology. she is passionately concerned about tax policies, healthcare reform, and national security. karen is an registered voter and actively participates in local and national elections.

in her free time, karen enjoys cooking, gardening, and volunteering at her church's community outreach programs. although she doesn't formally volunteer, she participates in neighborhood initiatives, helping those in need. karen is an avid user of the internet, staying informed about current events through online news outlets and social media platforms.

karen's specific economic concerns center around preserving social security benefits, implementing tax reforms that benefit middle-class families, and ensuring access to quality, affordable healthcare for all citizens. her values of hard work, family, and community underpin her conservative views, making her a conservative rep/lean persona.
